---
title: Welcome to the Quartz Theme for MDFriday
---

**Quartz** is a fast, batteries-included theme for **MDFriday** that turns your Markdown notes into a fully functional website with minimal setup. Built for students, developers, researchers, and knowledge workers, Quartz makes it effortless to publish personal notes, documentation, digital gardens, and knowledge bases to the web.

With tight **Obsidian compatibility** and a streamlined publishing workflow, you can go from local notes to a live website in minutes.

![[obsidian-mdfriday-gold.jpg|800]]

---

## ğŸª´ Get Started

Getting started with Quartz on MDFriday is straightforward:

1. Install the **Obsidian Friday plugin**
2. Choose the **Quartz** theme
3. Download the sample content
4. Build and preview locally
5. Publish your site

Thatâ€™s it â€” your notes are now a website.

No complex configuration. No build pipelines to manage. Just write in Markdown and publish.

For more details, visit:

* ğŸŒ MDFriday Official Site: [https://mdfriday.com](https://mdfriday.com)
* ğŸ“˜ Documentation: [https://help.mdfriday.com/index.html](https://help.mdfriday.com/index.html)

## ğŸ”§ Features

Quartz comes with powerful features out of the box:

- [[Obsidian compatibility]], [[full-text search]], [[graph view]], [[wikilinks|wikilinks, transclusions]], [[backlinks]], [[features/Latex|Latex]], [[popover previews]], [[i18n|internationalization]] right out of the box

Everything is optimized for performance, usability, and clean presentation â€” so your content remains the focus.

## ğŸš€ Why Quartz for MDFriday?

Quartz combines the flexibility of Markdown with the structure of a modern static site system â€” without requiring you to manage Node environments, CLI tools, or deployment pipelines.

If you already use Obsidian, Quartz on MDFriday provides a natural extension of your existing workflow:

Your knowledge deserves to be shared. Quartz makes it frictionless.
